Danube AgriFood Master
​ DAFM​
​joint master program
Joint Master degree study "Sustainability in Agriculture, Food Production and Food Technology in the Danube Region" (Danube AgriFood Master – DAFM) focuses on sustainable development as competent response to the upcoming challenges of climate change and protection and promotion of livelihoods. It uses the Danube region as a model region for all riparian regions worldwide.
APPLY NOW - for Intake 4

The call for Intake 4 Erasmus + countries still open until 31st March, 2025.​
Before applying , please read the DAFM application guide Intake 4 thoroughly before application!

The call for non-Erasmus+ countries has ended.
Thank you so much!

All submitted applications: 1434
More information under NEWS.
DAFM program aims to educate students, who are sensitive to sustainable agriculture and food production. To enhance the safety and stability of food production beside sustaining the environmental resources and eco-system services is crucial for adaptation to climate crisis, overpopulation and natural resources depletion.

The 120 ECTS joint degree MSc DAFM focuses on sustainable development as competent response to the upcoming challenges climate change and protection and promotion of livelihoods. It uses the Danube region as a model region for all riparian regions worldwide. It combines the unique expertise of the HEI-consortium to provide top-quality research based education in sustainable agriculture, soil, water, climate, food security, food production, food technology and intelectual learning as core contents. Program provides a solid basis in all relevant disciplines from natural sciences, engineering, economics to social sciences, offering extensive opportunities for interdisciplinary approaches and intercultural communication and promotes the idea of sustainable bioeconomy .

Full partners offering the DAFM Joint Degree are the Hungarian University of Agriculture and Life Sciences ( MATE ) (HU), the Czech University of Life Sciences Prague ( CZU ) (CZ), the University of Natural Resources and Life Sciences, Vienna ( BOKU ) (AT), the Slovak University of Agriculture Nitra ( SUA ) (SK), the University of Zagreb ( UNIZG ) (HR), the University of Novi Sad ( UNS ) (RS) and the University of Life Sciences „King Michael I” , Timisoara ( ULST ) (RO).
Programme: ERASMUS2027 Call: ERASMUS_EDU_2021_PEX_EMJM_MOB Project ID: 101050466

Program and curriculum

DAFM is a two-year master's program offered in English with contributions from all full and associate partners to the joint start-up module and all courses, including one compulsory joint summer or winter school, where all DAFM students meet every year.

​DAFM students are enrolled at two partner universities according to their mobility track. They spend their first and second semester at MATE (Gödöllő) or CZU (Prague) to gain basic knowledge for the designed program, for the third and fourth semester students can choose between BOKU, UNS, UNIZG, SUA and ULST. The fourth semester is essentially dedicated to the Master Thesis, supervised by a teacher of the second-year host university and co-supervised by the first-year university.

The curriculum consists of 2 Focus Areas with compulsory and elective courses:
* Please note special language proficiency requirements
The first year consists of 52 ECTS and the second consists of 56 ECTS, while the remaining 12 ECTS are distributed on summer school, internship and free elective courses. All DAFM students must attend compulsory summer school for 3 ECTS and an obligatory internship (100 working hours) for 3 ECTS. These internships are primarily offered by the associated non-academic partners of the consortia.

Prospects after graduation

​The graduates will have a holistic knowledge from "Farm to Fork".  From the cultivation of the soils till the safety of the food process in changing climate circumstances.
DAFM Alumni have academic knowledge focusing on the Danube Region (perfectly transferable to any other river basin area), as well as transversal skills (critical thinking, foreign languages, intercultural competences, entrepreneurial qualifications).
The acquired skills and comprehensive knowledge enable graduates to successfully work for public offices, research institutes, development agencies, regional advisory companies, wholesalers/retailers, food-processing companies, NGOs and governmental institutions. Involvement of companies and similar stakeholders guarantees the constant analysis and update of the curriculum with regard to job-market needs.

DAFM Summer School "Strengthening Agriculture in the Danube Region: from Nature-Based Solutions to Gender Equality" was held in Novi Sad, Srebia in the period from June 19 - June 23 2023 at the Faculty of Agriculture Novi Sad.
DAFM students got the opportunity to attend numerous lectures, workshops and presentations held by the DAFM consortium teachers. They also visited Special Nature Reserve "Koviljsko-Petrovaradinski Rit" and participated at Cooking Day where the students themselves prepared various international dishes.
Programme: ERASMUS2027 Call: ERASMUS_EDU_2021_PEX_EMJM_MOB Project ID: 101050466

APpLICATION procedure
​ Candidates from all over the world are eligible for this excellence programme funded by the European Union.
The DAFM offer scholarships (21 seats), tuition fee free seats (10) and also self-funded places.
* Please note, that in accordance with the 10% rule of the EMJM programmes only 2 candidates/nationality are allowed per intake.
For further info: https://erasmus-plus.ec.europa.eu/sites/default/files/2021-10/presentation-emjm-call2021_en.pdf
​
​ * Please note, students who have already benefitted from an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master (EMJM) scholarship are not eligible to apply for an additional scholarship

Application criteria

​If you are interested in applying for the Erasmus+ Master Programme in sustainable agriculture, food technology and food production, please check if you meet the requirements below:
  • Previous studies - Awarded Bachelor of Science degree (min. 180 ECTS) in Agriculture/Agronomy, Plant Biology, Biotechnology, Biochemistry, Master 1 Genetics, Molecular Biosciences or related relevant fields OR students in their last Bachelor year (only for EU candidates, due to lengthy visa procedures). Please find the previous studies accepted from all parties without further prescription of ECTS credits here ​
  • Due to the high number of applications, applicants must have an average GPA of at least 75% or higher .
  • English Language Proficiency - A minimum B2 in English except when English is your mother tongue. If not, please provide one of the official English tests such as:
* TOEIC: minimum 785 points
* IELTS: score 6.0 or better
* TOEFL: paper-based 577/computer based 233/
internet based 90-91
​ * Cambridge: Certificate of Advanced English
* First cetificate in English (FCE)
* Certificate in Advanced English (CAE)
* Certificate of Proficiency in English (CPE)
* Business English Certificate (BEC) Vantage- at least "Passed"
* Business English Certificate (BEC) Higher
* Certificate in English for International Business and Trade (CEIBT)
  • We also accept a university attesting English is the medium of instruction of your higher education, HOWEVER due to the high interest shown in our programme we warmly recommend every applicant to provide an official international language test. ( PLEASE NOTE! Applicants who select BOKU/Vienna for the 2 nd year, have to provide the proof of English proficiency required by BOKU at the time of application! ) ​
  • Application submitted online via homepage in English
  • Application containing all requested elements and documents

Documents required to apply

​If you meet all requirements and would like to apply to DAFM, the following list of documents will have to be attached to the application in scanned format:
  • Copy of your diploma(s) / degree(s) certificate(s) (add an English translation) or average GPA certificate from your university (in the year of graduation, for EU applicants only)
  • Copy of transcript of records for your whole degree and a grading scale (add an English translation)
  • Copy of official language certificate attesting language skills in English (Level min. B2)
  • Curriculum Vitae in a European format and motivation letter -  Curriculum Vitae must be in Europass format ( https://europa.eu/europass/en/create-europass-cv )
  • Passport
  • Proof of current and exact place of residence (see requirements below) *
  • Two recommendation letters **
  • Declaration on Honour ***
  • Privacy Statement DAFM ***
  • Other documents you consider relevant for the application (such as an affidavit, in case your name has changed in your documents, medical proof of special needs, DOI-number of publications, link of abstract books of the participation in conferences)
  • PLEASE, prioritize. Only submit the 3 most important publications/abstract of books. Publications and participations without proof won't be considered.
* An official document/card issued by authority stating your place of
residence
** Within the application procedure on the DreamApply surface two             email addresses of former lecturers or employers have to be
submitted. The system automatically will send an evaluation form to         the given person which has to be filled out by him/her. The form will
​     be submitted anonymously via DreamApply.
Please remind your referees of the automatic message sent by system,
might be put to the spam folder.
*** These two documents are to be found in the DreamApply system,               need to be read and signed.

! Important note !

All documents must be in pdf-format. Documents in other formats or pictures will not be considered.
All documents must be in English language. If it is not the case, add an English translation done by a certified, court-approved translator officially recognized by the issuing country.
​If you are selected to DAFM you must provide legalized documents such as your diploma, transcript of records or birth certificate. Those documents are not required at application stage so you don’t need to initiate expenditures in case of a non-selection of your application.
Referees often take time to write their recommendation letters so we strongly recommend you to take care of it well in advance.
  • A special need seat​ is available, please be aware that for SNI students the same general application procedure is required!

Information about online application

dafm_application_guide_intake_4.pdf
File Size: 202 kb
File Type: pdf
Download File
  • The application must be filled out in English.
  • The online application procedure takes some time so take that into consideration
  • Before starting your application, make sure you have all the required documents you will have to attach to your application (PDF format)
  • Don’t wait until the last moment to apply or the platform might shut down due to too much applications received at the same time
  • You can’t submit more than one application

Be aware that your application will be rejected without any possibility of appeal if your application is not complete , is not filled in                                                                             correctly or if you have uploaded wrong documents!

USE OF PERSONAL DATA

The European Education and Culture Executive Agency (EACEA), in the context of managing the Erasmus Mundus Joint Masters, collects and processes the personal data of some of the candidates. In particular, certain data of the scholarship holders and non-scholarship holders is shared with the Agency and treated according to this privacy statement

selection procedure

​The Danube Agrifood Erasmus Mundus programme allows us to offer:

  • scholarships to 5 EU and 16 non-EU candidates (1.400 EUR monthly stipend for max. 24 months)
  • tuition fee free seats to 5 EU and 5 non-EU candidates (the tuition fee for the DAFM programme is 4.500 EUR)
  • self payer candidates ​

  • A special need seat​ is available, please be aware that for SNI students the same general application procedure is required!

The DAFM Selection Board is responsible for the whole selection process and consists of the seven Selection Committees of each partner university. The Selection Committees involve 2 or 3 members, with academic, coordinating and administrative tasks.

scheduled timeline

DAFM Selection Timetable for academic year 2025/2026 – non-EU and IPA candidates:

Application deadline for non-EU candidates: 31st January 2025 - 23.59  GMT+1 (Be aware of the time zone!)
Interviews planned for the selected candidates: end of February
Announcement of results to applicant planned for: mid of March*

*This is an estimation only. The Selection Committee will update the timeline if necessary.
Please do not send us inquiries about your application - no results will be announced earlier.


​ Due to the high number of applications, the Selection Committee holds the right to re-schedule, if necessary.
Changes will be communicated on the website, there is no capacity to answer inquiries of applicants individually. .
Thank you for understanding!


  • Number of submitted applications 1st intake: 517 (selected 26)
  • Number of submitted applications 2nd intake: 1342 (selected 26)

​Please be aware, that the DAFM Selection Committee does not publish any ranking lists or scores, nor gives out any information regarding the overall performance and scores to the applicants in email.
​

Pre-check

​After the deadline of the call, a pre-check of all applications is conducted by the DAFM Selection Committee. During this procedure all incomplete (missing information or document) and incorrect applications (form filled out not correctly, not in English or the admission requirements are not fulfilled, wrong documents uploaded etc. …) will be removed automatically without evaluation to the non-selected list.

Selection of programme and partner country applicants

All valid applications will be then divided into two groups: Programme or Partner country applications.
  • Programme Countries are countries within the EU
  • Partner Countries are all other countries

​These two groups will be evaluated separately, as the applicants are not competing with each other.
Please note that a maximum of 2 applicants from the same nation can receive a scholarship according to the Erasmus Mundus rules so it is not efficient to assess all applications received from the same country if there are many applications.
Therefore, countries from where more than 15 applications are received are put aside in order to make a pre-selection of the best applicants only (between 5 and 10).
The pre-selection of the 5 to 10 best applicants per country is based on academic excellence and language skills. The pre-selected applicants are then assessed out of 100 according to the criteria detailed in the Scoring table 1.
Unfortunately the the rest of the applications of the same country will be put on the non-selected list without evaluation.
All other applicants from countries with less than 15 applicants will be assessed based on the criteria in Scoring Table 1:
Scoring Table 1 - Evaluation of applications
​In the end of step 2, the Selection Board will receive two lists, one for the programme and one for the partner groups. Since the DAFM programme is an excellence programme of the Europen Union, only applicants who score at least 75 points will be pre-selected. However, due to the high interest shown in our programme, each for the first intake pre-selected 90-100 applicants scored more than 80 points in this first round.
All other applicants will be put on the non-selected list.

Interview

The pre-selected applicants who have reached the threshold (of a min. of 75 points) are invited to an online interview process. The process will be conducted online via the Dream Apply system. The system will guide the applicant through the procedure.
The aim of the interview is to gain information of the applicant's academic and English language knowledge, along with his/her motivation as well as communication skills. The applicant's answers to the questions formulated by the DAFM Consortium will be recorded and evaluated according to the following scoring:


CRITERIA                                                             MAXIMUM SCORING
English knowledge                                                             30
Motivation                                                                           10
Knowledge                                                                          40
Communication and interpersonal skills                       20
​ TOTAL                                                                                100

final selection

The final selection of candidates is based on both the score obtained for the application and for the interview with the following weighing: 40% for application and 60% for interview .
Two ranking lists are made according to these percentages: one for Programme Country and one for Partner Country applicants.
In each ranking list (Partner and Programme Country), the Selection Committee selects the best ranked applicants to be part of DAFM (in respect of the geographical and gender balance) programme.
The min. threshold of 75 % applies here as well.
Non-selected applicants are placed on the reserve list (in ranking order).
Should the selected 90-100 interviewed applicants not reach the threshold, the Selection Board can decide to have further interviews with applicants from the reserve list (in ranking order.)

decision

All applicants will receive an email from the Dream Apply system in the end of the selection process.
Selected applicants will receive an email with information about their awarded seat of the DAFM programme.
Full scholarships (5 EU and 16 non-EU) and no scholarship, but tuition fee free statuses (5 EU and 5 non-EU) will be awarded.
In case of tuition free waived status, the selected applicant has to only finance his/her living expenses (min. 600 EUR per month) except for the tuition fee for the two years of study.
The non-selected applicants will receive an email as well at the same time.

Please note!
No rejection letters will be sent out until the decision has been made and all free seats filled.
Estimated timetable will be published soon.
The Selection Committee won’t publish any ranking lists and won’t give out any information of the applicants points.
​Thank you for understanding!


DAFM Appeal procedure ​

Applicants have the right to appeal against the decision on the rejection of application for acceptance to DAFM, if they believe that their application has not been treated fairly.
In this case the applicant must duly justify their reasons for appeal using the appeal form available on the website.
The form must be signed and needs to be sent (together with any applicable supporting documents) via E-mail to info@agrifoodmaster.eu within 10 days after having received the  decision at the end of the selection procedure.

The DAFM Consortium will review the candidate and reply within 14 days after receiving the appeal, with an explanation.
Be aware that your application will be rejected without any possibility of appeal if your application is not complete, is not filled in correctly or if you have uploaded wrong documents!
Important! The DAFM Consortium will not reveal any ranking lists or scores.

As we receive a high number of applications for the DAFM programme and the competition is very high, in case of questions you can also contact the DAFM Consortium via info@agrifoodmaster.eu at the end of the selection process, instead of sending an appeal.

Privacy statement of EACEA

“ The European Education and Culture Executive Agency (EACEA), in the context of managing the Erasmus Mundus Joint Masters, collects and processes the personal data of some of the candidates. In particular, certain data of the scholarship holders and non-scholarship holders is shared with the Agency and treated according to this privacy statement "

News

THE INTERVIEWS AND APPLICATIONS HAVE BEEN EVALUATED

3/19/2025

3 Comments

The offers for scholarshipholders and tuition free waives have been sent out, those who were under the threshold have been rejected. Those who have not got any notifications are on the reserve-list, please be patient! Thank you!
​
Please be aware the mobility tracks will be confirmed approx. in May and it is the decision of the Selection Committee.
3 Comments

The evaluation of the interviews has been started by the DAFM Selection Committee

2/27/2025

30 Comments

The DAFM coordination has received many emails from applicants who were not able to complete their interviews on the last day due to technical issues, unstable internet connection, travelling etc. We are sorry for the inconvenience, however we strongly advised in the invitation to complete the process that takes less than 10 minutes and does not require any preparation as soon as possible.
To be able to keep our timeline and to offer a fair and objective procedure we are not able to make exceptions after the expired deadline.
Thank you for understanding!

All applicants who have not been invited for the interview, or have not completed the interview process have been informed and rejected.
Thank you for your application, and in the name of the DAFM Consortium we wish you all the best for your future career!

Results of the selection process is expected by March 17, 2025

Thank you for your patience!

30 Comments

Invitations for the interviews

2/22/2025

0 Comments

Invitations for the interview process as the second part of the selection process have been sent out to the top 198 applicants.
Deadline for completing the interview 5 days from the invitation,  which is February 26th.
0 Comments

The call for non-Erasmus+ countries has ended

2/10/2025

25 Comments

​The prescreening of 1434 applications has been completed.
All candidates, who did not fulfil the academic or the formal requirements, have been informed via DreamApply.
Thank you very much for applying, and in the name of the DAFM Consortium we wish you all the best for your future academic path!

All other candidates, who have not received any message via DreamApply, have been forwarded to the Selection Committee and are under currently under evaluation.
Invitations for the interview process are estimated for the end of February.
Thank you for your patience!
25 Comments

The 4th call for non-EU applicants has been closed

2/1/2025

3 Comments

No of submitted application: 1434

Thank you!

Pre-screening is in progress, to screen the applications formally and academically.
Approx. 150 candidates will be invited to an online interview process. Details will follow.
As soon as we have some info, we will inform you here on the website.

For Erasmus + countries it is still open until 31st March, 2025.
3 Comments

New intake opened!

12/3/2024

0 Comments

​ The DAFM Consortium has opened the final call for Intake 4.

Fingers crossed for all applicants!
0 Comments

DAFM students at ELLS Scientific Student Conference 2024

11/28/2024

0 Comments

​Wageningen University hosted the annual Euroleague for Life Sciences (ELLS) ( https://www.euroleague-study.org/en ) conference from November 21-23 which included the ELLS Scientific Student Conference 2024 as well.  "The puzzle of Life Sciences - Add your piece" was the theme of the student conference, where students from ELLS universities presented their bachelor’s and master’s theses. DAFM students, who spent their second university year at BOKU University, were well represented this year, presented their master thesis topics and enjoyed this enriching expierence together with colleagues from other ELLS partner universities.
0 Comments

DAFM Summer School for Intake 2 students

7/8/2024

0 Comments

The DAFM Summer school for second-genaration of DAFM students was held in Zagreb, at our consortium partner university: University of Zagreb Faculty of Agriculture.
The topic of our 5-day Summer School was "Towards resilient agriculture" an it took place from July 1 to 5, 2024. The summer school was attended by 23 second-generation students of the DAFM study program.
A series of lectures during the summer school were held by professors from the UNIZG as well as professors from partner institutions, with a total of 17 lectures given. The summer school also included lectures at experimental fields, as well as a visit to Plitvice Lakes National Park.
dafm_summer_school_2024_agenda.pdf
File Size: 466 kb
File Type: pdf
Download File
0 Comments

The call for Intake 3 is closed

6/30/2024

0 Comments

​The call for EU-applicants is closed now. Thank you for your applications!
For Intake 3 we welcome altogether 37 DAFM students.
EU-scholarship holder: 5
Non-EU scholarship holder: 18
Non-EU tuition fee waived: 14

We are looking forward to a successful academic year of 2024-2025!

Next call for Intake 4 will be open: October/November 2024
0 Comments

First DAFM student completed his studies

6/28/2024

0 Comments

​The very first DAFM student has completed his 2 years Erasmus Mundus Master studies with a mobility track: MATE-ULST.
Congratulations!
More to follow soon!

Before you send a message, please search the webpage for information.
Due to the very high number of applications, we do not have the capacity of answering individual inquiries.
You may find the schedule for the Selection Procedure here .

Thank you for your patience and understanding.
